column2: and on the costs and opportunities associated with action to tackle it. A sound understanding of the economics of risk is critical here. It concludes that the levels of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere should be limited to somewhere within the range 450-550ppm CO2e (CO2 equivalent). Anything higher would substantially increase risks of very harmful impacts but would only reduce the expected costs of mitigation by comparatively little.
